The jQuery, required for UI Core.
Activates the noConflict mode of jQuery to work with other JS-Frameworks
The core of jQuery UI, required for all interactions and widgets.
Core utility for building UI controls.
Track and handle mouse-based interactions.
Place elements at specific locations in relation to other elements.
Allow elements to be moved using the mouse.
Create targets for draggable elements.
Change the size of an element using the mouse.
Use the mouse to select elements, individually or in a group.
Reorder elements in a list or grid using the mouse.
Displays collapsible content panels for presenting information in a limited amount of space.
Enables users to quickly find and select from a pre-populated list of values as they type, leveraging searching and filtering.
Enhances standard form elements like buttons, inputs and anchors to themeable buttons with appropriate hover and active styles.
Open content in an interactive overlay.
Drag a handle to select a numeric value.
A single content area with multiple panels, each associated with a header in a list.
Select a date from a popup or inline calendar.
Display status of a determinate or indeterminate process.
Themeable menu with mouse and keyboard interactions for navigation.
Enhance a text input for entering numeric values, with up/down buttons and arrow key handling.
Customizable, themeable tooltips, replacing native tooltips.
Extends the internal jQuery effects, includes morphing, easing and is required by all other effects.
Blinds the element.
Bounces an element horizontally or vertically n-times.
Clips the element on and off like an old TV.
A Drop out effect by moving the element in one direction and hiding it at the same time.
The element explodes in all directions into n pieces. Also supports imploding again.
The element will fades in or out.
Folds the element first horizontally and then vertically.
Highlights the background of the element in a defined color for a custom duration.
The element pulsates n times by changing the opacity to zero and back.
Grow or shrink any element and it's content and restore it again.
Shakes the element horizontally or vertically n times.
The element slides in and out of the viewport.
Transfer effect from one element to another.
A jQuery plugin to give advanced easing options.
Adds mouse wheel support for your application! Just call mousewheel to add the event and call unmousewheel to remove the event.
jQuery Lint works over the top of jQuery and diligently reports errors and any incorrect usage of jQuery. It will also, to some extent, offer guidance on best practices and performance concerns.
Touch-Optimized Web Framework for Smartphones & Tablets.
A simple, lightweight jQuery plugin for reading, writing and deleting cookies
The plugin restores deprecated features and behaviors so that older code will still run properly on jQuery 1.9 and later
Simple and flexible HTML, CSS, and Javascript for popular user interface components and interactions.
Extends the jQuery.support object to CSS3 transition
A streamlined, but flexible, take on the traditional javascript modal plugin with only the minimum required functionality and smart defaults.
Add dropdown menus to nearly anything in Bootstrap with this simple plugin. Bootstrap features full dropdown menu support on in the navbar, tabs, and pills.
The ScrollSpy plugin is for automatically updating nav targets based on scroll position.
This plugin adds quick, dynamic tab and pill functionality for transitioning through local content.

Inspired by the excellent jQuery.tipsy plugin written by Jason Frame; Tooltips are an updated version, which don't rely on images, use css3 for animations, and data-attributes for local title storage.
Add small overlays of content, like those on the iPad, to any element for housing secondary information.
The alert plugin is a tiny class for adding close functionality to alerts.
Do more with buttons. Control button states or create groups of buttons for more components like toolbars.
Get base styles and flexible support for collapsible components like accordions and navigation.
A generic plugin for cycling through elements.
A basic, easily extended plugin for quickly creating elegant typeaheads with any form text input.
This plugin will set fixed position to elements.
The most important UI widget on the web
Transforms tabs into a working slideshow
The ability to navigate through tabs with the browser's back and forward buttons
The second most important UI widget on the web.
A sliding tooltip effect with customized sliding directions, dimensions and speeds
Dynamic positioning of the tooltip so that it always stays in the viewport
A generic HTML scrolling widget
Makes an infinite loop from the scrollable items so that there is no beginning or end
Makes the scrolling behaviour automatic. highly configurable
Provides navigation buttons for switching between pages in scrollable
Enables mousewheel support for scrollable
A generic HTML overlaying widget
A plugin for creating "lightbox" style image galleries
An overlay effect that you have seen on apple.com
HTML5 date input for humans
HTML5 range input for humans
HTML5 input validation for humans
The future of Flash embedding. Works as a standalone tool and jQuery is not required. flowplayer.js contains this script.
Back button for AJAX apps
Makes your HTML stand out from its surroundings
A generic mousewheel support for jQuery
The JavaScript component of Flowplayer - the Video player for the Web
Generate video controls with HTML and CSS
Generate video playlists with HTML and CSS
Generates embedding codes for Flowplayer
